thread.title: Lions blank Mariners, swing to fourth straight title game
thread.title_full: Lions blank Mariners, swing to fourth straight title game

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Lions blank Mariners, swing to fourth straight title game
text:
Lions blank Mariners, swing to fourth straight title game Troy Howard to face Boothbay for league crown Oct. 19 By Staff | Oct 16, 2015 Photo by: Mark Haskell Troy Howard's Erica Staples, middle, whacks the ball as teammate Hannah Banks, left, and Oceanside's Maggie Tinker look on during a Busline League middle school field hockey playoff game Oct. 15. The host Lions beat the Mariners 3-0. 
Belfast — And just like that, the Troy Howard Middle School field hockey team is back in the finals. 
Hosting fourth-seeded Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston on Thursday afternoon, Oct. 15 in the Busline League semifinals, the top-seeded Lions went on the offensive against the Mariners and emerged with a 3-0 victory. 
The win propels the Lions into the league championship game, set for Monday, Oct. 19 at Boothbay Region Elementary School. 
Troy Howard will face No. 2 Boothbay in the finals, which will begin at 3:30 p.m. 
The Wildcats defeated No. 3 Great Salt Bay 7-3 in another semifinal playoff game on Oct. 15. 
Oceanside defeated No. 5 Camden-Rockport 1-0 in double-overtime on Wednesday, Oct. 14 in a play-in game to earn the right to advance to face Troy Howard in Thursday's semifinal. 
The Lions are the three-time defending league champions and have won double-digit titles in recent decades. 
On Thursday, Erica Staples knocked in two goals to lead Troy Howard Thursday against Oceanside, while Hannah Banks added one. 
Brooke Richards and Madison Shorey split time in goal for Troy Howard. 
Lion coach Beth Baker was complimentary of Mariner goalie Alexa Barstow, who made “at least 25 saves” in the losing effort for the visitors. 
Team members for Troy Howard include Hailey Armstrong, Hannah Banks, Airianna Berry, Kayci Faulkingham, Chloe Harvey, Kayla Payson, Ellie Prespolis, Brooke Richards, Erica Staples, Mallory Tibbetts, Ella Arizoni, Savana Blood, Madison Burgess, Kiara Doolan, Hailey Hall, Madison Limeburner, Hailee Lindelof, Gracie Littlefield, Madisyn Morse, Reilly Nickerson, Ruth Anne Pease, Kellie Scott, Sadie Wheeler, Emily Woods, Sarah Woods, Emily Abbott, Natalie Curry, Tallulah Desrochers, Mary Jane Draper, Grace Hall, Maddison Santana, Reagan Seekins, Madison Shorey, Paige Sweetland and Chelsea Gaiero. The team is coached by Beth Baker and Sara McIntire. 
Team members for Oceanside include Audrey Young, Hannah Simmons, Sophia Campbell, Amanda Frost, Julie Sprayberry, Marina Lamkins, Jade Phillip, Maggie Tinker, Julia Bartlett, Alexa Barstow, Erin Corcoran, Cadence Lamkins, Mareh Willis, Erin Stevenson, Maria Protheroe, Quincie Flynn, Emma Gerrish, Anna Campbell, Cassi Evans, Grace Young, Seanna Montgomery and Chloe Simmons. The team is coached by Andrea Garver. 
Team members for Camden-Rockport include Greta Bishop, Alyssa Bland, Annika Charland, Gail Curtis, Greta Curtis, Sage Curtis, Lillian Dailey, Charlotte Hood, Lyra Kalajian, Alison Linares-Mendoza, Meredith Luce, Anunthaya MacDonnell, Kennedy Peterson, Rachael Rademacher, Lillia Stone, Phoebe Walsh, Kathryn Desrosiers and Molly McClellan. The team is coached by Matthew Smith. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401. Troy Howard players near the bench have fun as they pose for a photo.
